cluster_relations.rel_desc: Rhodopis is the central young girl character in the Rhodopis Cinderella tale.
The king in the Rhodopis tale is a character in the Rhodopis Cinderella story.

qualifiers.CausalHint: after he finds her lost slipper
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Role: ruler who selects heroine via slipper

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The lost slipper is a key plot element in the Rhodopis Cinderella tale.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: within the events of the tale
qualifiers.CausalHint: enables the king to identify her
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Function: identification token for the heroine

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a narrative element (e.g., character, object, or plot device) that belongs to or appears within the specified narrative work or tale.
args.justification: All three relations link a narrative component (characters or a plot device) to the same tale. Despite different raw labels ('character_in', 'plot_element_of'), the semantics are the same: the subject is an element of the narrative. A unified predicate 'is_element_of_narrative' captures this without overfitting to role type.

Each relation connects a component of a story (character or plot element) to the overarching tale, which is best modeled as a structural relation within a narrative. Grouping them under 'narrative_structure_relation' captures this family of predicates.

The relations express membership/association of narrative elements with a specific tale, not causality, temporality, or composition in a material sense. The broad category 'ASSOCIATION' best captures this membership-style narrative linkage.
